articles.title: Ozempic: A hashtag and a helpful effect collide, draining global stocks of a diabetes drug - News24
articles.description: People with type 2 diabetes in South Africa have been left without one of their most effective - and cheaper - treatments because doctors are now also prescribing it widely as a weight loss drug.
articles.content:
• There is a global shortage of a popular and effective medicine used by people with type 2 diabetes.

articles.title: Telcos spend N613bn on 4G, 5G - Punch Newspapers
articles.description: Investments in infrastructure by MTN Nigeria and Airtel Africa rose to N613.13bn in 2022, underpinned by capital expenditure in 5G and 4G, the financial statements of the two telcos have shown.

articles.title: 'We want a bigger share': Botswana, De Beers row over diamond profits - Africanews English
articles.description: Under the 2011 agreement, the mining company De Beers received 90% of the rough diamonds produced while Botswana, Africa's largest diamond producer, received 10%

articles.title: Telescope video shows part of the sun breaking off and forming a vortex, making scientists scratch their heads - Business Insider South Africa
articles.description: NASA's solar observatory caught a strange polar vortex on the sun, and now plasma is erupting from its north pole.
articles.content:
A giant filament of plasma appears to have broken away from the sun and swirled around its north pole in a tornado-like vortex.
